sentence.Network_en: They just goof around, roll around on the floor and fight.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们整日就是瞎闹，在地上摸爬滚打。

sentence.Network_en: But was it, in fact, a hideous goof?
sentence.Network_cn: 但事实上这是否是个弥天大错？
你会把事情完全搞糟的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: of unknown origin; 比较 goop

entry.tran: 犯愚蠢的错误；出大差错
entry.def: If you goof or goof up, you make a silly mistake.

example.ex: We goofed last week at the end of our interview with singer Annie Ross.
example.tran: 上周我们采访歌手安妮·罗斯，结果到快结束时犯了个愚蠢的错误。

entry.def: If you call someone a goof, you think they are silly.

example.ex: I could write for TV as well as any of those goofs.
example.tran: 我写的电视剧肯定一点儿不比那帮笨蛋写得差。

means.word_mean: 1. a man who is a stupid incompetent fool
1. commit a faux pas or a fault or make a serious mistake;

example.en: These things are my ideas, and they've all got the same goof-ups.
example.zh: 这些是我出的主意，他们都犯了同样的大错。

list.explanation: 经常把事情搞糟的人，笨蛋

example.en: The sergeant was a confirmed goof-up.
example.zh: 那中士是人们所公认的笨蛋。

auth_sentence.content: Even the art teacher was seen as a goof.

auth_sentence.content: Other than that grammatical goof, great page.

auth_sentence.content: Goof or no goof, there is no cause for embarrassment.

Sentence.sentence: The real reward of goof teaching is seeing students learn.
